p: Among the compounds identified from Ancistrocladaceae, Tshitenge et al. also isolated four naphthylisoquinolines, named ealamines A–D ( 26 to 29, Fig. 8) from the twigs and leaves of Ancistrocladus ealaensis (Ancistrocladaceae) harvested in Mbandaka, DR Congo [ 67]. These compounds were tested against CQ-sensitive NF54 and CQ- and pyrimethamine-resistant K1 strains of P. falciparum. The activities against the CQ-sensitive NF54 strain showed IC 50 values of 6.3, 4.9, 0.84 and 22.2 μM, respectively. Meanwhile, compounds 26, 27 and 29 inhibited the CQ- and pyrimethamine-resistant K1 strain with IC 50 values of 1.6, 1.4, and 8.2 μM, respectively [ 67].
